member.name: T:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalExpLogTests
member.summary:
Test all methods in BigDecimal.Exp.cs. That means all methods for exponentiation, finding roots, and logarithms.
For a useful exponent calculator:

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalExpLogTests.Exp_0_Returns1
member.summary: Exp(0) returns 1.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalExpLogTests.Exp_1_ReturnsE
member.summary: Exp(1) returns E.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalExpLogTests.Exp_PositiveIntegers
member.summary: Test Exp() with positive integers.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalExpLogTests.Exp_NegativeIntegers
member.summary: Test Exp() with negative integers.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalExpLogTests.Exp_PositiveFloats
member.summary: Test Exp() with positive floating point values.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalExpLogTests.Exp_NegativeFloats
member.summary: Test Exp() with negative floating point values.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalExpLogTests.TestExpSmallInts
member.summary:
I generated these expected results using Python.
from mpmath import mp, exp
# Set the precision (number of decimal places) mp.dps = 50 # 50 decimal places of precision
# Loop through integer values from -12 to 12 for i in range(-12, 13): theta = i * mp.pi / 6 ex = exp(theta) print(f"{i} => \"{ex}\",")

member.name: T:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests
member.summary: Test class for checking the number of guard digits used by each operator and method is correct.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestUnaryFunction(System.Func{Galaxon.BigNumbers.BigDecimal,Galaxon.BigNumbers.BigDecimal})
member.summary: Test a unary function for rounding errors using random values.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestBinaryFunction(System.Func{Galaxon.BigNumbers.BigDecimal,Galaxon.BigNumbers.BigDecimal,Galaxon.BigNumbers.BigDecimal},System.Int32)
member.summary: Test a binary function for rounding errors using random values.
member.param: The number of tests to run.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForIncrement
member.summary: Test guard digits for the increment operator.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForDecrement
member.summary: Test guard digits for the decrement operator.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForSqr
member.summary: Test guard digits for the Sqr method.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForCube
member.summary: Test guard digits for the Cube method.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForTruncate
member.summary: Test guard digits for Truncate().

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForAdd
member.summary: Test guard digits for the add operator.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForSubtract
member.summary: Test guard digits for the subtract operator.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForMultiply
member.summary: Test guard digits for the multiply operator.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForDivide
member.summary: Test guard digits for the divide operator.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForModulo
member.summary: Test guard digits for the modulo operator.
member.remarks: This one fails regardless of the number of guard digits used. I think it's because Truncate() works with decimal places but the results of methods and operations are constrained by the number of significant figures.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForExponentiation
member.summary: Test guard digits for the exponentiation operator.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalMathTests.TestGuardDigitsForPow
member.summary: Test guard digits for the Pow() method.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalNumericTests.TestRoundingMethods
member.summary: Compare BigDecimal.Round() matches decimal.Round() for all rounding methods.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalNumericTests.TestFloor
member.summary: Compare BigDecimal.Floor() matches double.Floor().

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalNumericTests.TestCeiling

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalPowTests.Pow_BaseNegExponentRationalEvenDenominator_UnsolvableThrows
member.summary: Test that attempting to calculate x^y where x is negative and y is a rational with an even denominator will throw an exception.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalRootTests.Sqrt_NumberLargerThanLargestDouble_ReturnsCorrectResult
member.summary: In this test, both the initial argument and the square root are larger than the largest possible double value.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalRootTests.Sqrt_NumberSmallerThanSmallestDouble_ReturnsCorrectResult
member.summary: In this test, both the initial argument and the square root are smaller than the smallest possible double value.

member.summary: Test cube root of values up to 1000.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalRootTests.RootN_PositiveIntegerParameter_LargeN_ReturnsCorrectValue
member.summary: This tests Pow() and RootN() with large exponents. It takes 37 seconds on my computer, so be patient.

member.summary: Test odd roots of some negative values.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigDecimalRootTests.RootN_NegativeParameter_EvenN_Throws
member.summary: Test even roots of negative values throw exceptions.

member.summary: This code will run before every test in the project.

member.name: M:Galaxon.BigNumbers.Tests.BigRationalConvertTests.TestCastFromDoubleFuzzy
member.summary: This example shows how a double converts exactly to a BigRational, but also how the double only stores an approximation of the original decimal fraction.

The arguments to pass to the script.
